item.title: 全球股票基金因盈利希望而吸引第五周资金流入
item.description: 截至 7 月 24 日的一周内，全球股票基金迎来了新的投资，尽管主要科技股下挫，因为投资者对第二季度仍然强劲的盈利季节和美联储可能的降息仍持乐观态度。【原文：Global equity funds witnessed fresh investments in the week through July 24 despite a selloff in leading technology stocks as investors remained optimistic about a still-strong second-quarter earnings season, and potential Fed rate cuts.】

item.title: 交易员坚持美联储下周按兵不动、9 月减息的观点
item.description: 周五，与美联储政策利率挂钩的期货合约小幅上扬，此前数据显示上月基本通胀略强于预期，反映出市场对9月开始的一系列降息前景仍有信心。 交易员们仍然相信美联储将在下周的会议上保持利率稳定，并继续押注美联储将在下周的会议上减息。【原文：Futures contracts tied to the Federal Reserve's policy rate on Friday edged up only slightly after data showed underlying inflation last month was a bit stronger than expected, reflecting continued confidence in the prospect of a series of interest rate cuts starting in September. Traders remain convinced the Fed will keep rates steady at its meeting next week, and continue to bet the Fed will del】

item.title: 美国 6 月通胀温和上升
item.description: 美国 6 月份物价温和上涨，凸显出通胀环境正在改善，这有可能使美联储在 9 月份开始降息。【原文：U.S. prices rose moderately in June, underscoring an improving inflation environment that potentially positions the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates in September.】

item.title: 美国起诉安德鲁-勒夫（Andrew Left）涉嫌操纵股市 1,600 万美元
item.description: 美国司法部周五表示，一个联邦大陪审团以多项证券欺诈罪起诉了著名激进做空者安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left），指控他长期操纵市场，涉案金额达 1600 万美元。【原文：A federal grand jury has indicted prominent activist short seller Andrew Left on multiple counts of securities fraud for a long-running $16 million market manipulation scheme, the U.S. Justice Department said on Friday.】

item.title: 需求强劲，高露洁-棕榄公司上调 2024 年业绩预期
item.description: 牙膏生产商高露洁-棕榄公司周五上调了对全年利润和有机销售额的预期，此前该公司第二季度业绩超出预期，原因是对其高价产品的需求具有弹性。【原文：Toothpaste maker Colgate-Palmolive raised its forecasts for annual profit and organic sales on Friday, after beating second-quarter estimates on resilient demand for its high-priced products.】

item.title: 美国起诉香橼资本及其创始人安德鲁-勒夫（Andrew Left）涉嫌操纵市场
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）和司法部周五起诉做空机构香橼研究公司（Citron Research）及其创始人安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）涉嫌证券欺诈。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and the Department of Justice on Friday sued short seller Citron Research and its founder Andrew Left for alleged securities fraud.】

item.title: 消息人士称日产削减日本顶级工厂的产量
item.description: 两位知情人士称，日产汽车本月将把其日本顶级工厂的计划产量削减三分之一，此举还将导致日产汽车削减一款旗舰跨界车型的产量，因为日产汽车正努力应对美国市场对其老化产品阵容的疲软需求。【原文：Nissan cut planned production by a third at its top Japanese plant this month, a move that will also see it slash output of a flagship crossover model, two people said, as it struggles with weak U.S. demand for its ageing line-up.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车电池制造商 CATL 第二季度利润增长 13.4
item.description: 周五提交的一份股票市场文件显示，中国电动汽车电池巨头 CATL 第二季度净利润同比增长 13.4%，连续第二个季度实现增长。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle battery giant CATL's second-quarter net profit jumped 13.4% year on year, a stock market filing showed on Friday, extending gains for a second straight quarter.】

item.title: 财政部可能暂时保持大部分拍卖规模稳定
item.description: 美国财政部很可能在下周宣布，将在下一季度保持大部分附息美国国债拍卖规模的稳定，这将使市场在近期大幅加息后得到一些缓解。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department is likely to announce next week that it will keep most of its coupon-bearing U.S. Treasury auction sizes steady over the coming quarter, offering the market some relief after recent large increases.】

item.title: 受市场反弹提振，T Rowe Price利润大增
item.description: 资产管理公司 T Rowe Price 周五公布，第二季度调整后利润增长了 11%，这主要得益于市场的持续反弹提升了客户的投资价值，并减轻了资金外流带来的冲击。【原文：Asset manager T Rowe Price reported an 11% jump in second-quarter adjusted profit on Friday, helped by a relentless market rally that has boosted the value of clients' investments and softened the hit from an outflow of funds.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，巴里-迪勒称派拉蒙对 IAC 的追求 "可能已经结束"。
item.description: 据 CNBC 周五报道，亿万富翁巴里-迪勒（Barry Diller）表示，他的数字媒体集团 IAC 不再参与收购派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的竞争。【原文：Billionaire Barry Diller signaled his digital-media conglomerate IAC was no longer in the race to buy Paramount Global , CNBC reported on Friday.】

item.title: 保险公司 Mapfre 受美国经济复苏和自然灾害减少的提振
item.description: 西班牙保险公司 Mapfre 周五表示，由于自然灾害减少且更加温和，以及在美国的汽车保险业务出现转机，该公司上半年净利润大幅增长。【原文：Spanish insurer Mapfre said on Friday its first-half net profit jumped thanks to fewer and more benign natural disasters and a turnaround in its car insurance business in the United States.】

item.title: 独家报道沃尔玛欲斥资 2 亿美元打造自动驾驶叉车--消息人士
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，沃尔玛计划斥资 2 亿美元购买自动驾驶叉车，作为更广泛的仓库自动化工作的一部分。【原文：Walmart has plans to potentially spend $200 million on self-driving forklifts as part of broader efforts to automate more warehouse operations, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德克斯户外（Deckers Outdoor）股价大涨，原因是霍卡（Hoka）和 UGG 鞋类的全价销售有助于上调财年利润预期
item.description: 德克斯户外（Deckers Outdoor）周五盘前股价大涨 11%，至 932 美元，此前这家运动服装公司上调了年度利润预期，押注于热销的 Hoka 跑鞋和 UGG 靴子的全价销售。【原文：Deckers Outdoor shares jumped 11% to $932 before the bell on Friday after the sportswear company raised its annual profit forecast, betting on full-price sales of its hot-selling Hoka running shoes and UGG boots.】

item.title: 新药助力百时美施贵宝第二季度业绩超预期
item.description: 制药商百时美施贵宝公布的第二季度业绩好于预期，主要得益于贫血治疗药物 Reblozyl 和心脏药物 Camzyos 等新产品以及畅销产品血液稀释剂 Eliquis 的增长。【原文：Drugmaker Bristol Myers Squibb posted better-than-expected second-quarter results, driven by growth from new products like anemia treatment Reblozyl and heart drug Camzyos as well as from its top-seller, blood thinner Eliquis.】

item.title: 3M上调全年利润预期，原因是需求复苏和成本削减
item.description: 上周五，3M 公司上调了全年调整后利润预期的下限，预计将受益于重组措施和电子产品需求的增长，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨超过 4%。【原文：3M Co raised the low end of its full-year adjusted profit forecast on Friday expecting to benefit from restructuring measures and increasing demand for electronics, sending its shares up more than 4% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 多伦多证券交易所期货上涨；美国通胀数据受关注
item.description: 周五，与加拿大主要股指挂钩的期货收复了一些失地，因为投资者在等待美国的关键通胀数据，以判断美联储首次降息的时机。【原文：Futures linked to Canada's main stock index regained some ground on Friday as investors awaited a crucial inflation reading from the United States to gauge the timing of the first interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 纳斯达克期货跳涨，超级大盘股回暖；通胀数据受关注
item.description: 纳斯达克期货周五大涨 1%，原因是大型科技股和芯片股在本周早些时候遭受重创后反弹，同时投资者希望当天晚些时候公布的重要数据能进一步缓解通胀。【原文：Nasdaq futures jumped 1% on Friday as megacap tech and chip stocks bounced back after a drubbing earlier this week, while investors hoped for a further let-up in inflation in a crucial data release later in the day.】

item.title: 早间竞价股票尝试摆脱困境并进行轮动
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 独家报道墨西哥在炼油厂延期后寻求更多 2025 年燃料进口协议
item.description: 半打贸易商说，墨西哥正在寻求为明年进口比先前计划更多的汽车燃料，以弥补其新的奥尔梅卡炼油厂延迟投产的损失，这标志着国家能源公司 Pemex 的转向。【原文：Mexico is seeking to import more motor fuel for next year than it had previously planned, to compensate for delays in the startup of its new Olmeca refinery, half a dozen traders said, marking an about-turn by state energy company Pemex.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西国家石油公司正就从穆巴达拉公司回购炼油厂一事进行尽职调查
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）的三位知情人士告诉路透社，该公司在 2021 年以 16.5 亿美元的价格出售给阿布扎比主权基金穆巴达拉公司（Mubadala）的 Mataripe 炼油厂的竞标尽职调查工作正在收尾。【原文：Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras is wrapping up due diligence for a bid on the Mataripe refinery it sold to Abu Dhabi sovereign fund Mubadala for $1.65 billion in 2021, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 受惊吓的美国股市面临科技财报雷区和美联储会议
item.description: 震荡的投资者正准备迎接市场上最大科技公司的财报、美联储政策会议和密切关注的就业数据，在这一周里，这些都可能决定美国股市在经历一阵剧烈动荡后的近期轨迹。【原文：Rattled investors are bracing for earnings from the market’s biggest tech companies, a Federal Reserve policy meeting and closely watched employment data in a week that could determine the near-term trajectory of U.S. stocks following a bout of severe turbulence.】

item.title: 德国卡车制造商特拉通因价格上涨而实现利润增长
item.description: 由大众汽车控股的德国卡车制造商特拉顿周五公布，尽管欧洲市场需求依然低迷，但受价格上涨的提振，上半年营业利润增长了 7%。【原文：German truckmaker Traton , majority-owned by Volkswagen , on Friday posted a 7% rise in first-half operating profit buoyed by higher prices, even as demand remained lacklustre in Europe.】

item.title: Take Five：大科技公司的门上得分
item.description: 本周对各国央行来说是重要的一周，美国、日本和英国的政策制定者都将重新考虑贷款利率，而市场则对美国科技巨头的更多收益忐忑不安。【原文：It's a big week for central banks, with policymakers in the United States, Japan and Britain all due to reconsider lending rates and markets on edge over more earnings from U.S. tech giants.】

item.title: 泰国将为混合动力汽车制造商提供投资激励措施
item.description: 泰国投资委员会（BOI）周五表示，泰国将为混合动力汽车制造商提供投资激励措施，混合动力汽车的消费税将从2028年下调至2032年。【原文：Regional auto making hub Thailand will introduce investment incentives for manufacturers of hybrid vehicles, its Board of Investment (BOI) said on Friday, with excise taxes for hybrids to be lowered from 2028 to 2032.】

item.title: 英国维珍媒体 O2 流失 10 多万移动合约客户
item.description: 英国宽带和移动运营商维珍媒体 O2 第二季度流失了 11.84 万移动合约客户，反映出高端市场的疲软，因为新款 iPhone 和竞争设备的创新速度放缓。【原文：British broadband and mobile operator Virgin Media O2 lost 118,400 mobile contract customers in the second quarter, reflecting weakness in the top-end of the market where innovation in new iPhones and competing devices has slowed.】

item.title: 投资者称税收漏洞的终结有可能削弱申银万国的上市吸引力
item.description: 关注该行业的投资者表示，欧盟和其他国家当局终止对低价值包裹减税的举措威胁到了Shein的盈利能力，并有可能在这家快速时尚零售商计划上市前削弱其长期吸引力。【原文：Moves by authorities in the European Union and elsewhere to end tax breaks for low-value parcels threaten Shein's profitability and risk denting the fast fashion retailer's long-term attractiveness ahead of its planned stock market debut, investors who focus on the sector said.】

item.title: 欧元区消费者 6 月份不再降低通胀预期
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周五的一项调查显示，欧元区消费者在连续四个月下降通胀预期后，6月份不再降低通胀预期。【原文：Euro zone consumers stopped reducing their inflation expectations in June after four consecutive monthly falls, a European Central Bank survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英伟达供应商 SK 海力士将投资 68 亿美元在韩国龙仁建设芯片工厂
item.description: 全球第二大内存芯片制造商 SK Hynix 周五表示，已决定投资约 9.4 万亿韩元（68 亿美元），在韩国龙仁规划的半导体产业集群中建设首个芯片工厂和商业设施。【原文：The world's second-largest memory chipmaker SK Hynix said on Friday it has decided to invest about 9.4 trillion won ($6.8 billion) in its first chip plant and business facilities at a planned semiconductor cluster in Yongin, South Korea.】

item.title: Qoo10 韩国电子商务部门的困境加剧，各公司纷纷断绝关系
item.description: 总部位于新加坡的 Qoo10 旗下的两个韩国电子商务平台周五因未能向供应商付款而陷入更深的危机，公司与供应商断绝了关系，愤怒的客户涌入其办公室要求退款。【原文：Two South Korean e-commerce platforms owned by Singapore-based Qoo10 slipped deeper into crisis on Friday after failing to make payments to vendors, with companies cutting ties and irate customers thronging their offices demanding refunds.】
